com.samskivert.util

Class RandomUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.util.RandomUtil

  • @ReplacedBy(value="com.samskivert.util.Randoms")
public class RandomUtil
extends Object
    Provides miscellaneous utility routines to simplify obtaining useful random number values and to centralize seeding and proper care and feeding of the pseudo-random number generator.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Random rand
      The random number generator used by the methods in this class.

      • getWeightedIndex

        public static int getWeightedIndex(int[] weights)
        Pick a random index from the array, weighted by the value of the corresponding array element.
        Parameters:
        weights - an array of non-negative integers.
        Returns:
        an index into the array, or -1 if the sum of the weights is less than 1. For example, passing in {1, 0, 3, 4} will return: 
        
 0 - 1/8th of the time
 1 - never
 2 - 3/8th of the time
 3 - half of the time

      • getWeightedIndex

        public static int getWeightedIndex(int[] weights,
                                   Random r)
        Pick a random index from the array, weighted by the value of the corresponding array element.
        Parameters:
        weights - an array of non-negative integers.
        r - the random number generator to use
        Returns:
        an index into the array, or -1 if the sum of the weights is less than 1. For example, passing in {1, 0, 3, 4} will return: 
        
 0 - 1/8th of the time
 1 - never
 2 - 3/8th of the time
 3 - half of the time

      • getWeightedIndex

        public static int getWeightedIndex(float[] weights)
        Pick a random index from the array, weighted by the value of the corresponding array element.
        Parameters:
        weights - an array of non-negative floats.
        Returns:
        an index into the array, or -1 if the sum of the weights is less than or equal to 0.0 or any individual element is negative. For example, passing in {0.2, 0.0, 0.6, 0.8} will return: 
        
 0 - 1/8th of the time
 1 - never
 2 - 3/8th of the time
 3 - half of the time

      • getWeightedIndex

        public static int getWeightedIndex(float[] weights,
                                   Random r)
        Pick a random index from the array, weighted by the value of the corresponding array element.
        Parameters:
        weights - an array of non-negative floats.
        Returns:
        an index into the array, or -1 if the sum of the weights is less than or equal to 0.0 or any individual element is negative. For example, passing in {0.2, 0.0, 0.6, 0.8} will return: 
        
 0 - 1/8th of the time
 1 - never
 2 - 3/8th of the time
 3 - half of the time

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(T[] values)
        Picks a random object from the supplied array of values. Even weight is given to all elements of the array.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item or null if the array is null or of length zero.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(T[] values,
                               T skip)
        Picks a random object from the supplied array of values, not including the specified skip object as a possible selection (equality with the skipped object is referential rather than via Object.equals(java.lang.Object)). The element to be skipped must exist in the array exactly once. Even weight is given to all elements of the array except the skipped element.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item or null if the array is null, of length zero or contains only the skip item.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(Collection<T> values)
        Picks a random object from the supplied Collection.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(Collection<T> values,
                               Random r)
        Picks a random object from the supplied Collection.
        Parameters:
        r - the random number generator to use.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(List<T> values)
        Picks a random object from the supplied List
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(List<T> values,
                               T skip)
        Picks a random object from the supplied List. The specified skip object will be skipped when selecting a random value. The skipped object must exist exactly once in the List.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(List<T> values,
                               T skip,
                               Random r)
        Picks a random object from the supplied List. The specified skip object will be skipped when selecting a random value. The skipped object must exist exactly once in the List.
        Parameters:
        r - the random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(Iterator<T> iter,
                               int count)
        Picks a random object from the supplied iterator (which must iterate over exactly count objects.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - thrown if the iterator provides fewer than count elements.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(Iterator<T> iter,
                               int count,
                               Random r)
        Picks a random object from the supplied iterator (which must iterate over exactly count objects using the given Random.
        Parameters:
        r - the random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - thrown if the iterator provides fewer than count elements.

      • pickRandom

        public static <T> T pickRandom(Iterator<T> iter,
                               int count,
                               T skip)
        Picks a random object from the supplied iterator (which must iterate over exactly count objects. The specified skip object will be skipped when selecting a random value. The skipped object must exist exactly once in the set of objects returned by the iterator.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected item.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - thrown if the iterator provides fewer than count elements.
